title: Tesco worker collapsed and died 30 minutes after confronting shoplifter
text:
Hilary Simmons died after collapsing while on a cigarette break at Tesco Express (Picture: North News)

A Tesco worker died after confronting a shoplifter in store which left her ‘shaken’ and ‘angry’.

Hilary Simmons, 59, collapsed 30 minutes after the confrontation at a Tesco Express in Middlesbrough on 30 April last year.

She told staff at the time she felt like she was ‘going to have a heart attack’.

Within half an hour, the mum-of-two had collapsed while on a cigarette break and the emergency services were called.

She later died that same day at James Cook University Hospital.

Hilary was a shift leader when two men walked in. One of them, Michael James Love, stole a bottle of wine and hid it in his jacket – despite being banned from the store for stealing on a previous occasion.

She saw the theft and confronted Love, who then left with his friend but the confrontation left Hilary ‘angry’ and ‘shaken’.

Hilary (right) with daughter Alison Simmons, died of natural causes contributed to by dealing with the stress of shoplifting (Picture: North News)

Two men aged 35 and 37 were later arrested on suspicion of manslaughter and attempted theft from the shop but were released ‘with no further action’.

Two other men – aged 33 and 38 – were arrested on the same charges and released without charge.

Cleveland Police confirmed in May that the criminal investigation had been closed.

An inquest at Teesside Coroner’s Court this week heard that Hilary, despite appearing healthy, had severe heart disease.

There was an abnormality in the rhythm of her heart with ‘extensive scarring’ along with atheroma in her coronary arteries with ‘severe blocking’.

Hilary collapsed outside the Corporation Road store in Middlesbrough on 30 April 2018 (Picture: Evening Gazette)

Such was the severity of her heart disease, the inquest was told that she could have succumbed to ‘sudden death’ at any moment.

But a post-mortem examination found that death would be more likely ‘after a period of stress’.

Senior Coroner, Clare Bailey, concluded that Hilary died as a result of natural causes, contributed to by dealing with the stress of shoplifting.

Her medical cause of death was ischemic heart disease and coronary artery atheroma.
